title: Ticket #936: VOMS serialization is imprecise
description: VOMS currently serializes attributes into a string using ':' as a separator. However, (in theory) all characters are legal in DNs and in FQANs.
remarks:
2009-Dec-11 07:31:52 by zmiller:
i'm adding condor_config knobs for X509_FQAN_DELIMITER and X509_FQAN_ESCAPE, with defaults ":" and "\\". actually, i wonder if you can set something in the condor_config file to the c string "\\" (i.e. a single backslash).

2009-Dec-14 22:56:04 by zmiller:
new defaults for quoting:
  • delimiter is a comma: ','
  • the escaping is done html-style. comma become "," and ampersand becomes "&". the delimiter is then an actual comma, ",".

using the voms-admin web interface, it is currently not even possible to create roles that utilize either of these characters. voms-proxy-init also barfs on many nonalphanumeric charcters. (yes, when properly escaped from the shell)
